com.qtplaf.library.database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.database.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    A Database is a dictionary for Field's, Table's and View's. Domains are organized by name because they are sharable among tables and views of different physical databases, while tables and views are organized by catalog, schema and name.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database(DatabaseProvider databaseProvider)
      Constructor assigning the database provider.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DatabaseProvider getDatabaseProvider()
      Returns the database provider.
      Field getField(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a field of the given name retrieving it from the provider and caching it in the fields map.
      Table getTable(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a table definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider.
      Table getTable(java.lang.String schema, java.lang.String name)
      Returns a table definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider.
      Table getTable(java.lang.String catalog, java.lang.String schema, java.lang.String name)
      Returns a table definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider.
      View getView(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a view definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider.
      View getView(java.lang.String schema, java.lang.String name)
      Returns a view definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider.
      View getView(java.lang.String catalog, java.lang.String schema, java.lang.String name)
      Returns a view definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider.

      • getField

        public Field getField(java.lang.String name)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a field of the given name retrieving it from the provider and caching it in the fields map.
        Parameters:
        name - The field name.
        Returns:
        The field or null if not found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any persistence error occurs.

      • getTable

        public Table getTable(java.lang.String catalog,
                      java.lang.String schema,
                      java.lang.String name)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a table definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider.
        Parameters:
        catalog - The catalog name.
        schema - The schema name.
        name - The table name.
        Returns:
        The table definition or null if not found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any persistence error occurs.

      • getTable

        public Table getTable(java.lang.String schema,
                      java.lang.String name)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a table definition lazily retrieving it from the database provider. This is a simplified version for providers with a single catalog and several schemas.
        Parameters:
        schema - The schema name.
        name - The table name.
        Returns:
        The table definition or null if not found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any persistence error occurs.
